47. The other [Haarlem painter] was accustomed by Nature
to practice Drawing and Engraving,
and finally Painting, which has made him known
as a Phoenix with golden feathers.
What metal would not yield to gold?
What light resembles the Sun?
He is devoted to his practice
and bears the name of the Victory tree.
right-middlePliny writes that the Phoenix has some golden feathers.

48. By this artist this one saw a drawing
on Attalus skin, decorated with grapes, showing
The Inventor of Wine, Giver of Pleasure, Dispeller of Care,
along with Abundance. Lest they freeze in the midst
of their joy, Desire, accompanied with white Doves,
is blowing on a fire, causing the flames to leap;
wherever Reflection or Echo strikes
brings a shimmer to the Figures.

49. This Daedalus-piece, where the lovely
Charities enjoy themselves, makes the pleasure garden
of Hesperides here in our own time.
If some envy the honor of foreigners,
the song of Fame will hurt them doubly.
For it is far easier to deprecate this work
full of the mystery of Art, equal to Zeuxisâ€™ Wrestlers,
than to make one as beautiful.
right-middleThis piece by Golztius is in Rome.

50. Now having departed the dark night,
we find ourselves where the day is in season
and a pleasant time, in green meadows
lying and sitting, to amuse ourselves:
thus reflection begins to do its work,
for we partake of the green
from the foliage of trees, grasses, and plants
in our faces and bare skin.
right-middleOn the reflection of green on bare skin, when one sits in green meadows or gardens. right-middleOn the reflections of nudes posed against colored objects.

div.ab:
51. In the same way, when faces or bare limbs
cast shadow against wool, silk or linen,
Reflection will achieve its essence.
flesh color will take on yellow or red
with such reflections.
One also sees, where the Muscles vanish,
a reflection: the skin color reflection on itself.
right-middleLarge, broad reflections often create a good effect, but one must take care not to let the small reflections on nudes produce dryness or ugliness.

52. On round columns one also sees revealed
a backlight, as elsewhere on the bases
on white Eggs or balls of Marble,
with all the more contrasts, if bright objects are nearby;
